translated: The Parivāra🔽The Verses of Freedom from Restraints
The Questions on Non-separation
Non-co-residence with monks and nuns,
Some kind of enjoyment is not obtained there;
There is no offense due to non-separation,
This question was thought of by the skilled ones.
What is not to be given away, what is not to be broken,
Five were spoken of by the Great Sage;
There is no offense for one who gives it away, for one who uses it,
This question was thought of by the skilled ones.
I do not speak of ten persons,
Eleven are excluded;
There is an offense for one who pays respect to an elder,
This question was thought of by the skilled ones.

original: Na ukkhittako na ca pana pārivāsiko,
analyzed: na ukkhittakaḥ na ca pana pārivāsikaḥ
translated: One who is not suspended, nor one on probation,

original: Na saṅghabhinno na ca pana pakkhasaṅkanto;
analyzed: na saṅgha bhinnaḥ na ca pana pakkha saṅkantaḥ
translated: Not one who has split the Saṅgha, nor one who has gone over to another faction;
Standing on the level of co-residence,
How can one be not in common with the training?
This question was thought of by the skilled ones.
Approaching the Dhamma, asking questions,
The skillful, beneficial Dhamma;

original: Na jīvati na mato na nibbuto,
analyzed: na jīvati na mataḥ na nibbutaḥ
translated: Not living, not dead, not extinguished,
What kind of person do the Buddhas speak of?

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Ubbhakkhake na vadāmi,
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  ubbhakkhake na vadāmi
translated: This question was thought out by the skilled ones.🔽I do not say it’s above the collar bone,
Nor below the navel.
Because of sexual intercourse,
How can one become expelled?
This question was thought out by the skilled ones.

analyzed: bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭim karoti  a desita vatthukam pamāṇa atikkanta
translated: A monk builds a hut by himself,🔽The site has not been approved and it exceeds the right size.
There is a start but no space left on all sides. There is no offense.

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṁ karoti,🔽Desitavatthukaṁ pamāṇikaṁ;
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭim karoti  desita vatthukam pamāṇika
translated: This question was thought out by the skilled ones.🔽A monk builds a hut by himself,🔽The site has been approved and it is the right size.
There is a start but space left on all sides. There is an offense.
This question was thought out by the skilled ones.
He does not do anything physical,

analyzed: na ca api vācāya pare bhaṇeyya
translated: Nor does he speak to others.
He commits a serious offense that is a ground for cutting off.
This question was thought out by the skilled ones.
He does not do anything physical or verbal,

analyzed: manasā api santaḥ na kareyya pāpa
translated: And he does not do anything bad mentally.
When he is expelled, how is he well expelled?
This question was thought out by the skilled ones.
He is not accused by anyone,

analyzed: vācā giram no ca pare bhaṇeyya
translated: One would speak with one’s voice, but not with the body,
One would commit an offense of speech, but not an offense of body.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
The training rules praised by the best of the Buddhas
Would be four saṅghadisesas,
And one would commit all of them by a single action.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
Both would be fully ordained together,
And one would receive robe-cloth from both of them.
There might be offenses that are different,
This question was thought out by those with skill.
Four people, having made an agreement,
Stole heavy goods.
Three were offenses entailing expulsion, but one was not.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
Questions on the offenses entailing expulsion, etc.
If a woman were inside,
And a monk were outside,
And there were no hole in the house,
Because of sexual intercourse,
How would one be an offense entailing expulsion?
This question was thought out by those with skill.

analyzed: telam madhum phāṇitam ca api sappi
translated: Having taken oil, honey, syrup, and ghee,
One would store them oneself.
Before seven days had passed,
If one uses requisites that are allowable, one commits an offense.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
With the offense entailing relinquishment,
with the offense entailing confession that is pure,
one commits it all at once.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
Monks may gather in a group of twenty
and do a legal procedure, perceiving it to be complete.
A monk may be standing twelve leagues away,

analyzed: kammam ca tam kuppeyya vagga paccayā
translated: and that legal procedure may be invalid because of a faction.
This question was thought out by those with skill.

original: Padavītihāramattena vācāya bhaṇitena ca,🔽Sabbāni garukāni sappaṭikammāni;
analyzed: padavī tihāra mattena vācāya bhaṇitena ca  sabbāni garukāni sa paṭikammāni
translated: By the mere crossing of a threshold, by the mere speaking of words,🔽all the heavy offenses entailing acknowledgment are committed.
One commits all those offenses at once.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
Wearing an upper robe,
wearing a double-layered outer robe,
all those are to be relinquished.
This question was thought out by those with skill.

original: Na cāpi ñatti na ca pana kammavācā,
analyzed: na ca api na ca pana kamma vācā
translated: There is no motion, and there are no announcements,

analyzed: na ca ihi bhikkhu iti jinaḥ avoca
translated: and the Victor said that there are no monks.

analyzed: saraṇa gamanam pi na tassa atthi
translated: He has no going for refuge,
and his full ordination is irreversible.

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Itthiṁ hane na mātaraṁ,🔽Purisañca na pitaraṁ hane;
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  itthim hane na mātara  purisam ca na pitaram hane
translated: This question was thought out by those with skill.🔽“One should not kill a woman,🔽Nor should one kill a man, one’s father.
A fool should kill an unrighteous person,
And immediately afterwards, he would be touched by it.

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Itthiṁ hane ca mātaraṁ,
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  itthim hane ca mātara
translated: This question was thought out by those with skill.🔽“One should kill a woman,
And one should kill a man, one’s father.
Having killed one’s mother and father,
One would not be touched by it afterwards.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
“Without accusing, without reminding,
One should do a legal procedure against someone who is not present.

analyzed: katam ca kammam su katam bhaveyya
translated: And that procedure would be a legitimate procedure,
And the Sangha that does it would be free from offense.
This question was thought out by those with skill.

original: Codayitvā sārayitvā,🔽Sammukhībhūtassa kareyya kammaṁ;🔽Katañca kammaṁ akataṁ bhaveyya,
analyzed: codayitvā sārayitvā  sammukhībhūtassa kareyya kamma  katam ca kammam a katam bhaveyya
translated: “Having accused, having reminded,🔽One should do a legal procedure against someone who is present.🔽And that procedure would be an illegitimate procedure,
And the Sangha that does it would commit an offense.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
“There’s an offense for one who cuts,
And there’s no offense for one who cuts.
There’s an offense for one who covers,
And there’s no offense for one who covers.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
Speaking truth that is weighty,

original: Musā ca lahu bhāsato;🔽Musā bhaṇanto garukaṁ,
analyzed: musā ca lahu bhāsato  musā bhaṇantaḥ garuka
translated: And speaking a lie that is light,🔽Speaking a lie that is weighty,

original: Saccañca lahu bhāsato;🔽Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.
analyzed: saccañca lahu  pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā
translated: And speaking truth that is light,🔽This question was thought out by those with skill.
Questions on offenses entailing confession, etc.
What’s determined, what’s red, what’s worn,
What’s made to order, and what’s allowable,
For one who uses them, there’s an offense.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
When the sun has set, a monk eats meat,

original: Na ummattako na ca pana khittacitto;
analyzed: na ummattakaḥ na ca pana khitta cittaḥ
translated: He’s not insane, nor is he deranged,
Nor is he overwhelmed by pain,

original: Na cassa hoti āpatti;🔽So ca dhammo sugatena desito,
analyzed: na cassa hoti āpatti  so ca dhammo sugatena desito
translated: And he doesn’t commit an offense.🔽That’s the Teaching of the One Well-Gone.
This question was thought out by those with skill.

original: Na rattacitto na ca pana theyyacitto,
analyzed: na ratta cittaḥ na ca pana theyya cittaḥ
translated: He’s not lustful, nor is he thieving,

original: Na cāpi so paraṁ maraṇāya cetayi;🔽Salākaṁ dentassa hoti chejjaṁ,
analyzed: na ca api saḥ param maraṇāya  salākam dentassa hoti chejja
translated: Nor does he intend to kill another.🔽For one who gives a token, there’s a serious offense;
For one who receives it, there’s a grave offense.
This question was thought out by those with skill.

analyzed: na ca api āraññakam sāsaṅka sammata
translated: What’s not in the wilderness, what’s considered dangerous,

analyzed: na ca api saṅghena sammuti dinnā
translated: And what’s not given with the consent of the Sangha,
And he hasn’t had the kaṭhina removed.
He leaves the robe there and goes away for half a kilometer.
There’s no offense for him if dawn breaks while he’s away.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
They’re bodily, not verbal;
All of them have different bases.
He may commit one, not the other, at the same time.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
They’re verbal, not bodily;
All of them have different bases.
He may commit one, not the other, at the same time.

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Tissitthiyo methunaṁ taṁ na seve,
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  tissitthiyaḥ methunam tam na seve
translated: This question was thought out by those with skill.
A nun, a woman, and a man, and three non-human beings,

original: Na cācare methunaṁ byañjanasmiṁ,🔽Chejjaṁ siyā methunadhammapaccayā;
analyzed: na ca ācare methunam byañjanasmi  chejjam siyā methuna dhamma paccayā
translated: And a hermaphrodite, and a paṇḍaka, and a monk,🔽And a nun, and a trainee nun, and a novice nun, and a novice monk, and a male novice, and a female novice, and a male lay follower, and a female lay follower, and a trainee nun, and a trainee male lay follower, and a trainee female lay follower, and a paṇḍaka, and a hermaphrodite.
This question was thought out by those with skill.
He asks a nun for a robe,

original: No ca saṅghe pariṇataṁ;🔽Kenassa hoti āpatti,
analyzed: na u ca saṅghe pariṇata  kenassa hoti āpatti
translated: But it hasn’t been given to the Sangha.🔽For whom is there an offense?
And for whom is there no offense with regards to relatives?

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Kuddho ārādhako hoti,
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  kuddhaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: This question was thought out by those with skill.🔽An angry person is successful,
And an angry person is to be censured.
What is that thing,
By which one who is angry is praised?

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Tuṭṭho ārādhako hoti,
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  tuṭṭhaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti
translated: This question was thought out by those with skill.🔽One who is satisfied is successful,
One who is satisfied is to be blamed;

original: Atha ko nāma so dhammo,🔽Yena tuṭṭho garahiyo;
analyzed: atha kaḥ nāma so dhammo  yena tuṭṭhaḥ garahiyaḥ
translated: What is that thing,🔽By which one who is satisfied is to be blamed?
This question was thought out by those with skill.
A saṅghādisesa, a thullaccaya,
A pācittiya, a pāṭidesanīya;
One would commit a dukkaṭa offense together,
This question was thought out by those with skill.

analyzed: ubho paripuṇṇa vīsati vassā  ubhinnam eka upajjhāyaḥ  ekā ācariyā ekā kamma vācā
translated: Both are twenty years old,🔽Both have the same preceptor;
One teacher, one Monastic Law, one anupasampanna;
This question was thought out by those with skill.

analyzed: a kappa katam na api rajanāya
translated: Not made, not dyed,
One who wears it may go wherever he wants;
There is no offense for him,
And that rule was taught by the Accomplished One;
This question was thought out by those with skill.
One does not give, one does not receive,
Because of that there is no receiving;
One commits a heavy offense, not a light one,
And that because of using it;
This question was thought out by those with skill.
One does not give, nor does one receive,
So there is no receiving by that means.
One commits an offense that is light, not heavy,
And that is because of using it.

original: Pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā.🔽Āpajjati garukaṁ sāvasesaṁ,
analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  āpajjati garukam sa avasesa
translated: This question was thought out by those with skill.🔽One commits an offense that is heavy, with a fixed penalty,
And conceals it out of disrespect.

original: Na bhikkhunī no ca phuseyya vajjaṁ,
analyzed: na bhikkhunī no ca phuseyya vajja
translated: One is not a nun, nor does one commit an offense entailing expulsion.

analyzed: pañhā mesā kusalehi cintitā  sā idam mocana gāthā niṭṭhitā
translated: This question was thought out by those with skill.🔽The verses on the release from abscesses are finished.
The summary:
Not living together, not giving back,
And ten, and not put aside;
Approaches, a legal issue, above the collar-bone,

original: Tato saññācikā ca dve.🔽Na kāyikañca garukaṁ,
analyzed: tato saññācikā ca dve  na kāyikam ca garuka
translated: And then two on perception.🔽Not bodily, and heavy,
Not bodily, and not verbal;
Without having accused, and training rule,
And both, and four kinds of people.
Woman, and oil, and relinquishment,
And monk, and a path;
Wearing, and not a motion,
Not to kill one’s mother or father.
Without having reminded, and having reminded,
Cutting, and the truth;
Determined, and when the person has died,
Not in use, and not in the wilderness.
Bodily and verbal,
And a nun, and a mother;
Angry, successful, satisfied,
And two offenses entailing suspension.
Not done, does not give,
Does not give, falls into an offense;
The verse on the end of the rains,
The question analyzed by the wise.
